result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger C Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution must be paid in full during the term of supervision. It is NOT the intention of the Court that restitution be taken from inmate accounts. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED 06-21-2017 TO MARK RESTITTUION JOINT AND SEVERAL AS ORDERED

Statutory costs assessed. Cost are to be paid during the term of supervision. It is NOT the Courts intention that costs be taken from inmate accounts.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not consume or possess any controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as vocational training, cognitive intervention and domestic abuse counseling. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Ms. Hanson needs to be able to speak with the ME and needs to speak with the victim's family. The State is asking that the JT remain on. Ms. Nolan indicates that she will be going forward preparing for trial and asks  that another table be brought in as she will have co counsel and they need room.

BTC: The State will not cross examine on the domestic violence point unless Ms. Riley brings it up. Other acts MIL is granted. Motion to sever is denied. Mr. Tishberg is to provide an order for no contact between Ms. Gilbertson and Ms Riley

from Atty Nolan, re: withdrawal of Motion to Dismiss/cancellation of 2/23 hearing.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendants, RDR and CAG.   No contact with the victims family, GKL (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

***SECOND AMENDED COMPLAINT ATTACHED 1/7/16***
